text: Gil da Cruz Trindade (born 1 March 1982) is an athlete from East Timor. He was the first, along with Aguida Amaral, to represent East Timor at the Olympics, competing in the marathon of the 2004 Summer Olympics in Athens, Greece.For Asia's smallest nations, chance in the Olympics already amounts to victory Trindade entered the race at the invitation of the International Olympic Committee, who sent him $250 and a plane ticket to Greece. While his only wish was to finish the race,Timorense só quer acabar a maratona Trindade failed to finish the marathon. ==Achievements== *All results regarding marathon, unless stated otherwise {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |2004 |Olympic Games |Athens, Greece |-- |DNF |} ==References== * Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:East Timorese male long-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of East Timor Category:East Timorese male marathon runners
title: Gil da Cruz Trindade
